section.title: Task List view
section.para: The Task List view is part of the standard Java perspective .

In case you closed the view , you can re-open it via
Window Show View Mylyn Task List
.

section.title: Create new tasks
section.para:
To create a new task press the New Task button or right-click in the Task List view and select
New Task
.
Select the Local repository, as depicted in the following screenshot.

section.title: Activate a task
section.para: To start working on a task, select the Activate task button. If the task has already captured a context , Mylyn filters the visible elements in the Package Explorer view.

textobject.phrase: Activate Tasks in the Package Explorer

section.para: You can remove the filter in the Package Explorer view by clicking the Focus on Active Task button in the toolbar of this view . Afterwards all files are displayed.
If you open a file while having an activated task, this file is added to the context of the task.
Once you have identified all necessary elements, you can focus again on the task to filter out the unnecessary elements.
If you have to switch to another task you simply can activate it. The context of the task will be restored.

section.title: Create task from Problems view
section.para: You can create a new Mylyn task from the Problems view , by right-clicking on a problem and selecting New Task from Marker... from the context menu.

section.title: Export and import your tasks
section.para:
Mylyn allows you to export and import your local tasks. Select your categories or tasks in the Task List view , right-click on them and select Export and Import
from the context menu.
